headline: Chef John's Dark Chocolate Mousse
description: Rich dark chocolate mousse is so easy to make and so impressive your guests won't believe you made it yourself. This has a pinch of hot chile just for extra flavor.

video.description: See how easy it is to make your own homemade chocolate mousse.
video.name: Dark Chocolate Mousse

name: Chef John's Dark Chocolate Mousse

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a saucepan of water to a simmer over low heat. Place chocolate, butter, 2 tablespoons water, ground chipotle pepper, and salt in a heatproof bowl; set bowl over the simmering water. When the butter melts, whisk the chocolate mixture gently until smooth and shiny. Set aside to cool for a few minutes.

Whisk egg yolks, 2 tablespoons water, and sugar in another heatproof bowl over the same pan of simmering water until egg yolk mixture is foamy and hot to the touch, about 3 minutes. Pour hot egg mixture into warm chocolate mixture, whisk until smooth, and set over a bowl of ice to chill. Whisk constantly until mixture has cooled to room temperature or slightly cooler.

Pour 1/2 cup and 1 tablespoon cold cream into a chilled metal bowl; whisk until cream holds soft peaks. Place about half the whipped cream into the cooled chocolate mixture; gently fold the cream into the chocolate. Repeat with remaining half of whipped cream, folding gently until nearly all the streaks have disappeared. Divide mousse into 4 6-ounce ramekins.
Cover each ramekin with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours (up to overnight) before serving.

review.reviewBody: Oh my gosh, my husband is not a fan of dark chocolate, but I made this using Nestle dark chocolate chips and he loved it! I left out the chipotle chile powder because I am a chocoholic and I don't want any added flavors. This is a keeper! I added a dollop of sweetened whipped cream on top and it was perfect.
I added Rum and Almond flavoring this time. I like to change it depending upon my guests. Chef John, you're the best!

Easy and incredibly rich. I used chocolate chips as that is what I had on hand. Per others tips, I sweetened the whipping cream slightly. The portions might seem smallish, but it's so rich, it's all you need! Definitely satiated my chocolate craving.
Fast and easy to make. The chili sparks it up making it unique and special. I’ve made it several times and always get rave reviews. Thank you, Chef John!

I never change recipes I find but I was looking for a basic mousse recipe and I have never gone wrong with Chef John. I need enough mousse to fill an Oreo Pie Crust to celebrate my son’s birthday. He requested Chocolate Mousse.
Excellent dessert . Easy to prepare. Big hit after a seafood or steak dinner.

I want to marry Chef John, love his recipes! Do not skip the chipotle chili powder, I was afraid but got over it and I’m glad that I was brave. The chipotle adds an extra dimension of flavor that if you didn’t know what it was you could not put your finger on. It also adds an ever so slight heat on your palate that’s so undetectable that you think you may think that you’ve imagined it. Nice and surprising sensation. 
I followed another reviewer and added two tbls of coffee instead of water to chocolate, it was delicious and brought out the flavor of the chocolate. Word of warning is that if you do this be sure to add a tbls or 2 of sugar to the chocolate, I added 2 and it was perfect.

I didn’t add the chipotle. It made two small portions. So I beat the egg whites with some sugar. Folded it in. I made coffee whip cream to top it.
I will put my chocolate covered strawberries on top later today. Think I might use a different recipe next time
I have made this one before also, but this time I used a dark magic coffee instead of the water. Turned out great.

love, love, love this chocolate mousse recipe! I've made it twice now exactly per recipe. My family loves it, and recently, I served for a small gathering of 5 friends, and they were absolutely in awe!! It goes down real smooth; not too rich, and just so heavenly. 
I would say it's easy for seasoned bakers, but not so easy for beginner bakers. My one tip, when whipping the cream, use an electric beater. I did see a few reviews saying whipping the cream took forever to reach right consistency. With electric beater, takes about 3 minutes - fast and easy. I used Guittard extra dark chocolate chips 68% cacao; and cayenne pepper powder. Thank you, Chef John, love the tip on the chile pepper (secret ingredient) and LOVE this recipe. Will make it time and time, again!
Only substituted Cayenne pepper and it came it out great.

I made this for Valentine's day exactly as stated and it was delicious. It was very easy to make which is even better. I did make it again and whipped up 3/4 cup whipping cream instead of what was called for. It made the dessert just a tad bit lighter and we liked it even better. Only thing I found was that, like others, I wouldn't say this would serve 4 people - they would be very small servings. I got 3 decent size servings from it.
Wonderful!
I added a dash of pure vanilla extract to the whipped cream topping, amazing result! I will definitely be making this again. Not overly sweet, just perfect!

This was a bit of work but not too bad. The key is to read the recipe a few times before starting and have everything ready to go so you can work quickly. Mine wound up with some chunks in it. I didn't want to over fold and knock all the air out and so I ended up not really combining things well enough. But still yummy.

I followed the recipe exactly, which is rare for me. It was scrumptious. It takes a little bit of skill to make, but it's not hard and it doesn't take a lot of time. Everyone in my family loved it! My son-in-law said he'll be requesting this for his birthday every year.

This recipe was awesome. It was every easy to make and several of my my guests thought it was "the best mousse I've ever had." I simply loved it... It was rich, smooth and that touch of Cayenne gave it that perfect pinch of heat.
Thank you!!
Absolutely great! And not difficult at all.
While this was delicious, the making of it was over my experience level. About wore my arm off with the whipping and took longer than the time I had allotted for.
Doubled recipe, used 2, 3.5oz Lindy Chili chocolate bars. Was very smooth and not too sweet. Piped it into mini-chocolate shells, and topped w/ raspberry.
I will definitely make this again. Delicious.

I followed the recipe and very much enjoyed it. However, I did not add any pepper to my mousse. I also added a tablespoon of powder sugar, as per the recommendation of some commenters. This caused the consistency of the cream to become dry and stiff, so I had to add more heavy cream. However, ended up tasting great!
My family asks me to make this at least once a month. The video was super helpful and the dessert itself is to die for. I bookmarked this page:)
The chocolate tasted a little to dark. (for me) but other than that it was awesome!
My husband loves this.
Servings are small but that's ok -- this is RICH!

OMG . . . this stuff is GOOD! The only adjustment that I made was to use a bit of espresso in place of the water. I had some espresso chocolate chips that I melted and piped into shapes of hearts, the word "Love" and "XOXO" to place on top of the whipped cream to give it a Valentine's Day theme. They turned out so elegant, and the flavor is pure decadence! Perfect for a special occasion.

I needed to add at least a quarter cup more water to get it to smooth out. I also added two more tablespoons of sugar and one more tablespoon of butter. It took that much more stuff before it looked like it did in the video. The flavor was excellent.

I’m not a fan of chipotle pepper so I left that out. As just a chocolate mousse on its own, it is scrumptious. I topped mine with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon sugar. Easy to follow recipe. Great results.
It was so amazing, it was so dense with chocolate,but I ended up with a lot of dirty dishes

I liked it, had other people eating it tell me it was good, but needed to be a little sweeter (used an organic dark chocolate chocolate bar). I had some difficulties with the chocolate cooling down too much in the ice and getting some almost fudge like chocolate in the mousse. I might sweeten the whipping cream before adding it to the chocolate mixture, other than that I really enjoyed it.
Perfect. No need to make changes.
Wonderful, very rich but light and airy... will definitely make it again!
i went a little heavier on the chipotle
I made this for the family and they loved it, the best there is, i never eaten it before, but it was great.

This was my first time making mousse, i never though it was that easy! I liked this recipe so much, i have made it twice this week. The hardest part is waiting for the mousse to set in the refrigerator ! Topped it with whipped cream and fresh berries! So good!
My first shot at it and it turned out perfect. And I'm a guy!
I made no changes and it was delicious!!

Went by recipe exactly and loved it. 
Not too sweet. 
Will definitely continue he making it.

I used Bakers Chocolate and it didn't turn out creamy like the video showed but I added some straight cream to thin out the final product and that seems to worked out. I am wondering if I should have used a 3/12 ounces of chocolate chips or a regular chocolate bar meant for consumption rather than the Bakers. I went a little light on the pepper. I may try it again.

I will make it again. The 6 oz dishes really only make enough for 3. So-fill them less !! I also would use coffee in the first addition of water and that might make it a little more interesting 
Otherwise, really did like !
Made it exactly as written. Delicious.
Very rich. Smaller portion than I expected. Chipotle was only okay, may omit next time. Easier recipe than it initially seemed like it would be.

Made this recipe today - I did not have Chipotle pepper/spice but even without it, the mousse tastes divine! Any substitute for egg yolk in this recipe would be a great help as my parents are pure vegetarian and I really want them to have this recipe. :-)
Delicious!
I made this with no alteration or substitution and it was excellent. Light and fluffy, rich chocolaty taste. This was a hit!
Made it just as the recipe said, except I doubled the servings. Very rich. Nobody even tasted the chipotle pepper. I would make again for a special occasion.

Made this for my chocoholic daughter's birthday. I used a warm brownie cup, put in the frozen good ice cream with mousse on the top, then covered with meringue, in broiler for a minute and it was to die for.

I made this exactly as prescribed. 

HUGE hit! This was the best dessert I've ever had. Chef John is amazing!
It was amazing! So much easier to make than I had thought. The chile pepper really adds to the chocolate flavour and the texture is perfect! Great recipe - a keeper :)

My hubby was travelling home after 3 weeks and I wanted to make something romantic and special. I had seen how to make chocolate edible cups, wanted a great M recipe for filling, When I saw one from chef John.. I looked no further. I got great reviews from my worst critic chocoholic friend. Waiting for hubby to land tonight and will enjoy dessert together.
I have tried many of your recipes in past. Every recipe of your's is fool proof. Thank you
Best chocolate mousse ever!
It's OK to me but my family deffinately didn't like it. I don't think they like spicy chocolate.
This is a very good dessert. I had to omit the peppers as we here have heartburn and digestive issues, but I still tasted the chocolate. Very well done and thanks for sharing xx

This recipe is super easy!! Since I did not have whipped cream, I saved the egg whites and whipped those. But I doubled the portion of egg whites. Ex: I used 2 egg yolks for the chocolate mixture and whipped 4 egg whites. This recipe is superb for a Valentines day treat!
I am a big fan of chocolate mousse and did not like this. I followed this recipe exactly and used Lindt 70% Cocoa bar. I did not find it sweet enough. Also, I was not a fan of the chipotle pepper.
Absolutely perfect! Not only the best recipe for chocolate mousse I have made, it's also the simplest. Thanks for sharing the recipe, Chef!
Made this for my mom for Mother's Day. She is a chocolate mousse connoisseur (or so she thinks). She loved it! We both did! Thank you!
I made it with Andes mints. Making this was more time consuming than I was used to but the results were fantastic. Jack and Marie loved it! It really does only make 4 dessert cups, though.
I've made this a few times now and it is delicious!!! I even subbed dark mint chocolate for half the chocolate and that was great too! I will be making this more in the future.

I looked and looked at recipes because I wanted to make something for National Chocolate Mousse Day (April 3) and decided on this one and WOW, it did not disappoint. I added the pepper but only had cayenne and I added strong coffee to the chocolate instead of water. It made for a hint of coffee that did not overpower the chocolate. This recipe is a winner!
Amazing! I've made this several times and it always turns out perfectly!

This was a lot easier to make than I had assumed. I also found that if I set the fully mixed mousse in the same ice bath I had whipped the cream and cooled the chocolate mix, it set up much more quickly than 4 hours.

I followed the directions exactly and it was perfect! The video was very helpful! My family was worried, at first, that they wouldn't have enough dessert, but the mousse is so rich, everyone was very satisfied with the amount. We topped ours with whipping cream with a couple of tablespoons of powdered sugar mixed in. We will definitely have this again.

Delicious! And OH, SO EASY! Very elegant and romantic dessert. I'd make it again. Used a dark chocolate candy bar with 77 Percent Cocoa. Also, added a couple of teaspoons of powdered sugar to stabilize the whipped cream and to balance the bitterness of the chocolate. Very happy with the results. Another great recipe from Chef John!

Very good and pretty easy to make. I did think the amount/portions were a bit off. I doubled it and if I did really want to serve 8 people, I don't think there would have been quite enough mousse. You definitely don't need a big portion of this though.

Love it! I'm a huge fan of dark chocolate and this recipe is fantastic. This was my first attempt at making mousse and I found the video and instructions easy to follow. The mousse held up well to me piping it into individual dessert cups. My fiancé found it to not be sweet enough so maybe next time I'll add sugar to my heavy cream before whipping it. I on the other hand thought it was just right. I used Lindt 70% cocoa, smooth dark chocolate.

Made this for a potluck dinner--I quadrupled the recipe and served it in a large casserole dish. The dish was practically licked clean by the end of the evening. It was easy to make, and everyone loved it. Even the gluten free folks could enjoy it.

Outstanding, simply outstanding! This recipe is the reason that Chef John is the first person I've added to my "chefs I follow". I've made it 4 times now in less than 3 weeks. I'm not a dessert person, but I like mousse, trifles, pudding etc. I received a couple good quality chocolate bars (Lindt) for xmas. The first time I made this I used the dark chocolate one. I did use less chili because I'm sensitive to hot spice, but it didn't bother me. It was killer good. The second time I used the milk chocolate bar because it was all I had. Equally good in a different way... softer, fluffier, more subtle. I used the full amount of chili powder. 2 more times with the dark chocolate. Every time is excellent. I'm now going to look for good quality sugar free chocolate so I can experiment with a diabetic friendly version for my husband. This recipe rivals chocolate mousse that I have eaten in any high quality restaurant. Thank you Chef John!
This recipe is delicious and very easy. My husband loves mint so I used half dark chocolate and half mint dark chocolate. Turned out really nice. Will certainly do this one again.
This recipe is delicious and very easy. My husband loves mint so I used half dark chocolate and half mint dark chocolate. Turned out really nice. Will certainly do this one again.

The chocolate Mousse was to rich but melted in your mouth at every bite. My family and I loved the dessert and will fix it again. The only thing that was weird was i didn't whip the cream to a peak, because it was taking to much time but it turned out very well anyway.

This is the best recipe for chocolate Mousse I have found! It so rich, and simple to make. I did not add as much pepper as it said though. Would rate it ten stars if I could! :) Thumbs up for Chef John!
